item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, January 25, 2025 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Life lessons from the first half-century of my career (146 points | 22 comments)
2. Show HN: Cs16.css – CSS library based on Counter Strike 1.6 UI (613 points | 110 comments)
3. First Look: Loops, by Pixelfed – Decentralised TikTok Competitor (2024) (14 points | 2 comments)
4. File Explorer is merged to Helix editor (114 points | 13 comments)
5. Show HN: Trolling SMS spammers with Ollama (189 points | 61 comments)
6. TinyZero (56 points | 13 comments)
7. Show HN: Using YOLO to Detect Office Chairs in 40M Hotel Photos (127 points | 56 comments)
8. Wild – A fast linker for Linux (311 points | 145 comments)
9. Show HN: Lightpanda, an open-source headless browser in Zig (188 points | 99 comments)
10. A phishing attack involving g.co, Google's URL shortener (282 points | 118 comments)
11. Snowdrop OS – a homebrew operating system from scratch, in assembly language (238 points | 50 comments)
12. The hidden complexity of scaling WebSockets (121 points | 34 comments)
13. Deadly and Imminent; The Pentagon's Mad Dash for Silicon Valley's AI Weapons (42 points | 33 comments)
14. Her dad, the 10k records he left behind and a viral lesson in grief (101 points | 47 comments)
15. Subpixel Snake [video] (233 points | 44 comments)
16. You could have invented Fenwick trees (96 points | 16 comments)
17. Show HN: Onit – open-source ChatGPT Desktop with local mode, Claude, Gemini (110 points | 33 comments)
18. New book-sorting algorithm almost reaches perfection (206 points | 45 comments)
19. Caltrain's electric fleet more efficient than expected (262 points | 186 comments)
20. Chatbox: Cross-platform desktop client for ChatGPT, Claude and other LLMs (56 points | 13 comments)
21. Ask HN: Why buy domains and 301 redirect them to me? (297 points | 97 comments)
22. How I Use Home Assistant in 2025 (199 points | 221 comments)
23. Anatomy of a Formal Proof (106 points | 4 comments)
24. A very Chicago gamble (138 points | 69 comments)
25. A WebAssembly compiler that fits in a tweet (211 points | 25 comments)
26. Every System is a Log: Avoiding coordination in distributed applications (176 points | 130 comments)
27. Cloud Virtualization: Red Hat, AWS Firecracker, and Ubicloud internals (67 points | 11 comments)
28. Trying out Zed after more than a decade of Vim/Neovim (158 points | 108 comments)
29. Urban legend: I think there is a world market for maybe five computers (106 points | 65 comments)
30. Show HN: I recovered one of my earliest ZX-Spectrum games from an audio cassette (34 points | 4 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, January 25, 2025 at 9:15 AM UTC
